analyzed: rgyu ji skad bshad pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel cing mthun par 'brel pa dang ; ji skad bshad pa'i bsod nams kyis yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel par 'jug pa ste /

analyzed: yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bag chags kyi rnam grangs so //

analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na /

original: langs nas dus ha cang yun mi ring ba gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs nas dus ha cang yun mi ring ba gzung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sar pa smos pa ni langs nas ring po ma lon pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang dgra bcom pa nyid las gsar du langs pa dag ni yon tan sngar ma thob pa thob pas yid bde ba gzhol ba kho nar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi dbang po shin tu nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //

original: rgyu de dag gis gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa 'am gnod pa byas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gis gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa 'am gnod pa byas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of these causes, benefit or harm done to those five types of persons bears fruit in the present life.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs par yod pa de ni rang @49b bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can no //

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i lam ste /

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spangs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yang bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spangs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yang bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of stream entry is the complete result of the path of seeing and the complete result of abandoning that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing. The result of arhatship is the complete result of the path of meditation and the complete result of abandoning that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa las langs pa yin yang de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa las langs pa yin yang de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin na /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam las langs pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /

original: de ni gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi tshor bas bsdus pa'i rnam par smin pa de ste /üîΩrtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin zhes nges pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dir ni dbang po bsam pa las /

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i sems g-yeng gi / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la gnas pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de dag rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / g-yeng ba yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: las shin tu dang ba'i rnam par smin pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mi mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúDisagreeable‚Äù means

analyzed: mdo las gya gyu gang zhe na /

analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes lta ba la gya gyur bshad de /

analyzed: lus kyi las zhe sdang las skyes pa ni lus kyis nyes pa zhes bshad de /

original: yang ci'i phyir ma bsams pa dang nor pa dang ; bdag la srog gcod pa mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir ma bsams pa dang nor pa dang ; bdag la srog gcod pa mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is unintentional action, erroneous action, and killing oneself not considered to be killing?

original: sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag bdag gi rten can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag bdag gi rten can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the performance of the action is impossible, and because merit and demerit are impossible when the self is the basis.

original: de ltar bshad dang / gal te srog chags gzhan yin pa dang / 'di gsad par bya'o zhes de la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la sbyor ba byas pa de nyid gsod par byed kyi gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad dang / gal te srog chags gzhan yin pa dang / 'di gsad par bya'o zhes de la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la sbyor ba byas pa de nyid gsod par byed kyi gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If another living being is killed, and if one performs the action with the thought, ‚ÄúI will kill this,‚Äù and if the one who performs the action kills that very being and not another,

original: de lta na de las srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de las srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one would be touched by the offense of killing, but not otherwise.üîΩTherefore, it is said that one would be in a mental state of desire.

original: des na 'dod pa'i sems su byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la the tshom za ba de gnyi ga des yongs su dor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa'i sems su byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la the tshom za ba de gnyi ga des yongs su dor ba yin no //
translated: One would abandon both that in regard to which one has made preparation and that in regard to which one has doubt.

original: @57b ji ltar phung po skad cig bdag la srog gcod par 'gyur ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: @57b ji ltar phung po skad cig bdag la srog gcod par 'gyur ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could there be killing of a self that is momentary aggregates?

original: 'di ltar phung po skad cig ma da ltar ba ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor bas mi gsod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po skad cig ma da ltar ba ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor bas mi gsod de /
translated: The present moment of the aggregates is not killed by the preparation for killing,

original: rang nyid 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is already destroyed and is facing destruction.

original: de lta ma yin na yang skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be harmed by momentary destruction.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the future killed,

original: bsad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not capable of being killed.

original: bdag med na gsad par bya ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: bdag med na gsad par bya ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa mi srid do //
translated: If there is no self, then killing is impossible, because there is nothing that is killed.

original: bdag bsad pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag bsad pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that killing is the killing of a self.

original: rtag pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba mtha' dag lhags pas kyang rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsmras pa / mi 'tshe ba dang bdag rtag pa //
analyzed: rtag pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba mtha' dag lhags pas kyang rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // smras pa / mi 'tshe ba dang bdag rtag pa //
translated: because it is not transformed by the approach of any harm.

original: 'di la rgyu ni ci yod snyam //üîΩrnam pa kun na'ang shing srin las //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni ci yod snyam // rnam pa kun na'ang shing srin las //
translated: Objection: What is the reason for non-harm and the permanence of the self?

original: rdo rje bsrung bya ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bsrung bya ma yin no //
translated: Reply: The vajra is not protected from the woodworm in any way.

original: de ltar ba'i phung po 'gags pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ba'i phung po 'gags pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the life faculty is not severed by the cessation of the aggregates.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: srog ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The so-called life faculty is the life faculty that is the basis of heat and consciousness.

original: ji ltar rlung sems la rten zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rlung sems la rten zhe na /
translated: How is the life faculty dependent on the mind?

original: sems la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is dependent on the mind because it operates in dependence on the mind.

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / shi pa la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde gcod par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / shi pa la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de gcod par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, it does not occur in one who has entered the meditative attainment of cessation or nonperception or in one who is dead.

original: de'i rgyun dang 'gal ba'i phyir gcod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyun dang 'gal ba'i phyir gcod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is severed means it is severed because it is incompatible with the continuum of that life faculty.

original: 'di ltar srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar bsgrubs pas srog gi mtshan nyid da ltar ba 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar bsgrubs pas srog gi mtshan nyid da ltar ba 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of life that is future, arising, is directed toward cessation, since conditions that are incompatible with it have been established.üîΩ

original: srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can skye ba la rgyur mi 'gyur bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can skye ba la rgyur mi 'gyur bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the present characteristic of life that is directed toward cessation is interrupted because the future characteristic of life that is the object of arising is not a cause of arising, since the conditions that are incompatible with arising are established.

original: de skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen sgrub par byed pa po yang srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen sgrub par byed pa po yang srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the one who establishes the conditions that are incompatible with arising is also touched by the misdeed of taking life.

original: dper na mar me 'am dril bu'i skad 'gag par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na mar me 'am dril bu'i skad 'gag par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the one who causes the cessation of a lamp or the sound of a bell.

original: mar me'i skad cig ma da ltar ba 'gags pas mar me 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me'i skad cig ma da ltar ba 'gags pas mar me 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The present moment of the lamp does not cause the cessation of the lamp because it has already arisen.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma skyed par 'dod pa la skye ba'i gegs byed pas yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma skyed par 'dod pa la skye ba'i gegs byed pas yin te /
translated: It is because it prevents the arising of the future moment that is asserted to be the cause of arising.

original: dril bu'i skad dang / srog gi dbang po la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dril bu'i skad dang / srog gi dbang po la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the sound of a bell and the life faculty.üîΩWhat is the life of that which is without self?üîΩIf life is the life of the self, and if the self is living because of its connection with life, then when the self does not exist, what is the life of that which is without self?

original: srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni srog de ni bdag gi yin la de dang 'brel pas de nyid gson no zhes bya ba yin na de med na srog de gang gi yin zhes bya ba'o drug pa 'di don ji lta bu yin rje bo'i don
analyzed: srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni srog de ni bdag gi yin la de dang 'brel pas de nyid gson no zhes bya ba yin na de med na srog de gang gi yin zhes bya ba'o drug pa 'di don ji lta bu yin rje bo'i don
translated: What is the meaning of the sixth case in the phrase ‚Äúthe life of that which is without self‚Äù? It is the meaning of lord.

original: yin no // dper na gang gi rje bo gang @58a * //
analyzed: yin no // dper na gang gi rje bo gang @58a * //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe lord of that which is‚Äù is like ‚Äúthe lord of that which is not.‚Äù

original: yin pa lta bu yin dper na ba lang gi nag pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yin pa lta bu yin dper na ba lang gi nag pa lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe ox of that which is‚Äù is like ‚Äúthe ox of that which is not.‚ÄùüîΩHow is that the lord of that which is? It is because it is dependent on that which is.

original: 'di ji ltar de'i rje bo yin de rmo ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa dag la sbyor ba de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang zag tu smra bar dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar de'i rje bo yin de rmo ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa dag la sbyor ba de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang zag tu smra bar dpyad par bya'o //
translated: How is that the ox of that which is not? It is because it is dependent on that which is not.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la gson zhes bya'o bdag ni ma yin te de'i phyir srog gi dbang po ni de'i yin gyi bdag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la gson zhes bya'o bdag ni ma yin te de'i phyir srog gi dbang po ni de'i yin gyi bdag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body together with the faculties is called ‚Äúalive,‚Äù but not the self. Therefore, the faculty of life force belongs to that, but not to the self.

original: blo sngar ma btang ba'i srog bcad pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: blo sngar ma btang ba'i srog bcad pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur ba las /
translated: ‚Äú Killing a living being without first intending to do so‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni blo sngar btang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni blo sngar btang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not only when one first intends to do so.

original: dper na me dang reg pa las tshig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni blo sngar btang ngam ma btang yang bla te /
analyzed: dper na me dang reg pa las tshig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni blo sngar btang ngam ma btang yang bla te /
translated: For example, ‚Äúone is burned by fire and contact‚Äù means that whether one first intends to do so or not,

original: reg pa rnams 'tshig ste de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro srog chags gsod pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa rnams 'tshig ste de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro srog chags gsod pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: one is burned by contact because it is the result of that. Killing a living being should be explained in the same way.

original: de dag gi ltar na gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg pa la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg pa la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: According to them, it follows that seeing and touching another‚Äôs wife would also be like that.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg na 'dod chags can rnams la chos ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan pha dang bu la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba blo sngar ma btang ba rnams la yang chos ma yin par 'gyur ro
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg na 'dod chags can rnams la chos ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan pha dang bu la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba blo sngar ma btang ba rnams la yang chos ma yin par 'gyur ro
translated: Just as seeing and touching another's wife is unrighteous for those who are lustful, so it is unrighteous for those who are free from attachment and have not previously given their minds to others, such as their father, son, and so on.

original: // gcer bu ba skra 'bal ba na khros pa na bsod nams 'dod pa yang chos ma yin pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // gcer bu ba skra 'bal ba na khros pa na bsod nams 'dod pa yang chos ma yin pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: When a naked ascetic pulls out his hair in anger, he who desires merit becomes connected with unrighteousness.üîΩWhen he teaches severe austerities, the teacher who desires to benefit him, or another, becomes connected with sin.

original: dka' thub drag po'i lung 'bogs pa na don ma yin pa 'dod pa ltar de la phan par 'dod pa'i ston pa'am gzhan yang sdig pa dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro de dag gsung de shi na zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa gsung de shi na de la
analyzed: dka' thub drag po'i lung 'bogs pa na don ma yin pa 'dod pa ltar de la phan par 'dod pa'i ston pa'am gzhan yang sdig pa dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro de dag gsung de shi na zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa gsung de shi na de la
translated: If he dies while speaking that speech, means that if the naked ascetic dies while speaking that speech, he who desires to benefit him, or another, becomes connected with sin.

original: gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i zas sbyin par byed pa ltar de la phan par bya ba'i phyir sbyin par byed pa bsod nams 'dod pa yang kha na ma tho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i zas sbyin par byed pa ltar de la phan par bya ba'i phyir sbyin par byed pa bsod nams 'dod pa yang kha na ma tho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that one who gives food mixed with poison with the intention of benefiting the one who eats it would have vile actions, just like one who gives food mixed with poison with the intention of harming the one who eats it.

original: ma dang bu lto na yod pa dag kyang sdig pa dang 'brel par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma dang bu lto na yod pa dag kyang sdig pa dang 'brel par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would follow that a mother and the child in her womb would be related to vile actions,

original: phan tshun sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the conditions for each other‚Äôs suffering.

original: gal te me'i dpes blo sngar ma btang ba'i srog bcad pas kyang sdig pa yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te me'i dpes blo sngar ma btang ba'i srog bcad pas kyang sdig pa yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you accept that killing is a vile action even when the mind is not corrupted,

original: de ltar na gsad par bya ba yang de'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na gsad par bya ba yang de'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: then it would follow that the one who is killed would also be related to that action,

original: gsod pa'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsod pa'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: because he is related to the action of killing.

original: chos ma yin pa can du thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩme rang gi rten sreg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa can du thal bar 'gyur te / me rang gi rten sreg pa bzhin no //
translated: It would follow that he would be related to nonvirtue,üîΩjust as the support of fire is burned by the fire.

original: me ni sngar rang gi rten sreg la phyis gzhan sreg par byed de /
analyzed: me ni sngar rang gi rten sreg la phyis gzhan sreg par byed de /
translated: Fire first burns its own support and then it burns other things.

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba yang sngar rang gi rten gsad par bya ba chos ma yin pa dang / sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba yang sngar rang gi rten gsad par bya ba chos ma yin pa dang / sbyor bar byed la /
translated: So too, when one dies, previously one was the nonvirtuous object to be killed and the one who kills.

original: phyis ni gsod pa @58b po sbyor bar byed par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang me'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir byed du 'jug pa la yang sdig par thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyis ni gsod pa @58b po sbyor bar byed par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang me'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir byed du 'jug pa la yang sdig par thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Later, one becomes the one who kills.üîΩMoreover, it would not follow that one who instigates would be sinful because one accepts that fire is an object of Dharma.

original: gzhan gsod pa la sogs byed du 'jug pa la yang chos ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gsod pa la sogs byed du 'jug pa la yang chos ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not follow that one who instigates others to kill and so on would be sinful.

original: gzhan me la reg tu 'jug pa'i reg tu 'jug pa po des mi 'tshig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan me la reg tu 'jug pa'i reg tu 'jug pa po des mi 'tshig pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because the instigator who instigates others to touch fire is not burned.

original: shing la sogs pa sems med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa sems med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Also, it would not follow that those without mindüîΩare objects of Dharma.

original: shing dang smyug ma dang so phag la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: shing dang smyug ma dang so phag la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Those without mind are trees, bamboo, bricks and so on.

original: khyim rdib na srog chags 'chi ba'i phyir de'i khongs su gtogs pa shing la sogs pa rnams la yang sdig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim rdib na srog chags 'chi ba'i phyir de'i khongs su gtogs pa shing la sogs pa rnams la yang sdig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then when a house collapses and living beings die, it would follow that the wood and so on belonging to that house would be sinful.

original: yang na gtan tshigs med pas dpe tsam gyis ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs med pas dpe tsam gyis ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, since there is no reason, it is not established by mere example.

original: ngo tsha med pa rnams 'dam rdzab dri cher nga bas lus byug pa dang / gos med pa nyid dang / 'bab stegs dang gdung bas de lta bu la sogs pa ma rig pa mang du brdol ba de ni gcer bu pa de rnams kyi blun pa dang brdzun gyi tshig yin pas gus par mi bya'o //üîΩma byin lan par gzhan gyi nor //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa rnams 'dam rdzab dri cher nga bas lus byug pa dang / gos med pa nyid dang / 'bab stegs dang gdung bas de lta bu la sogs pa ma rig pa mang du brdol ba de ni gcer bu pa de rnams kyi blun pa dang brdzun gyi tshig yin pas gus par mi bya'o // ma byin lan par gzhan gyi nor //
translated: The naked ones, who are shameless, smear their bodies with mud and water, go about naked, and do such things on the banks of rivers and in temples, are fools who lie a lot, so their words should not be respected.üîΩStealing is taking the wealth of others without their consent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthus ni mngon sum du 'phrog par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthus ni mngon sum du 'phrog par byed la /
translated: By force is by directly robbing.

original: 'jab bus ni mngon sum ma yin par ro //
analyzed: 'jab bus ni mngon sum ma yin par ro //
translated: By stealth is by not being directly seen.

original: kha cig yongs su gzung ba med pas mchod rten las 'phrog pa la ma byin par len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar sems pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig yongs su gzung ba med pas mchod rten las 'phrog pa la ma byin par len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar sems pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Some think that because a stupa has no owner, taking something from a stupa is not taking what is not given.

original: sangs rgyas las ma byin par blangs pa yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las ma byin par blangs pa yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To respond to that, the root text states, ‚Äúit is taking what is not given from the Buddha.‚Äù

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas las ma byin par blangs she na /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas las ma byin par blangs she na /
translated: How can there be taking what is not given from the Buddha, since it is impossible for a Buddha to have an owner?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe de dag thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe de dag thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond to that, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause all of those are owned by the BhagavƒÅn at the time of his parinirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: skye bo sbyin pa po rjes su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo sbyin pa po rjes su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha accepts the offerings of those who give.

original: gzhan dag na re de bsrung ba gang dag yin pa de dag las ma byin par blangs so zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de bsrung ba gang dag yin pa de dag las ma byin par blangs so zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that it is taking what is not given from those who guard the stupa.

original: de ltar na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is not a great offense.

original: bdag po med pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa'i gter te /
analyzed: bdag po med pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa'i gter te /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout an owner‚Äù means a treasure that has no owner.

original: yul gyi bdag po las ma byin par blangs so //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po las ma byin par blangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the king‚Äù means from the king of the country.

translated: From what is it exceeded?

original: gzugs med pa dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang gnyis las so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang gnyis las so //
translated: From the two, the formless realm and the sentient beings without ideation.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su ldan pa nges par bshad pas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su ldan pa nges par bshad pas /
translated: Since it is explained that possession is definite in the formless realm,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su ldan pa dang mngon du gyur pa nges par brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su ldan pa dang mngon du gyur pa nges par brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: it should be stated that possession and manifestation are definite in the desire realm and the form realm.

original: de'i phyir khams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe realms are the three realms.‚Äù

original: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Except for the hells and Uttarakuru‚Äù means:

original: de na yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no morality of restraint there.

original: gzhan na ni gnyi ga yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan na ni gnyi ga yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú The other two exist in the other realms‚Äù means:

original: lha dag dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa ma gtogs pa'i mi dag gi nang na ni /üîΩsdom pas bsdus pa dang sdom pa ma gtogs pa yod do //
analyzed: lha dag dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa ma gtogs pa'i mi dag gi nang na ni / sdom pas bsdus pa dang sdom pa ma gtogs pa yod do //
translated: Among humans, with the exception of the gods and the humans of Uttarakuru,üîΩthere are those included in the vows and those not included in the vows.

original: kun du bsten pa dang / goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du bsten pa dang / goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivated, practiced, and repeated means:

original: kun du bsten pa ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: kun du bsten pa ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Cultivated means in the stage of preparation.

original: goms par byas pa ni dngos kyi gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: goms par byas pa ni dngos kyi gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Practiced means in the stage of the actual basis.

original: lan mang du byas pa ni mjug gi gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa ni mjug gi gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Repeated means in the stage of conclusion.

original: srog gcod pas ni tshe thung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bshad do //
analyzed: srog gcod pas ni tshe thung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bshad do //
translated: By killing, one has a short life. This explains the result that is similar to the cause.

original: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig mi btsun pa'o //
analyzed: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig mi btsun pa'o //
translated: By idle chatter, one's words are not accepted. This means one's words are not respected.

original: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the result that is similar to the cause.

original: lung du ma bstan pa mi dge ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu mthun pa brjod pa na ji ltar skyon can du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa mi dge ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu mthun pa brjod pa na ji ltar skyon can du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one says that the neutral is the natural outflow of the cause to be abandoned by the path of meditation, how could it not be faulty?üîΩTherefore, it is said in detail:

original: de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i rgyu mthun zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i rgyu mthun zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Killing is the natural outflow of the cause that obstructs life in that life.

original: dug dang gnam lcags dang mtshon cha lhags pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni srog gcod pa rnams kyi tshe dge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa 'byung ba la @69a * //üîΩgegs byed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: dug dang gnam lcags dang mtshon cha lhags pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni srog gcod pa rnams kyi tshe dge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa 'byung ba la @69a * // gegs byed par nus pa yin te /
translated: Whatever poisons, meteors, weapons, and so on there are, they are able to obstruct the arising of life projected by virtuous karma of those who kill.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not able to obstruct other lives.

original: de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that killing is the cause that obstructs life in that life.

original: gzi mthu chung ba ni nus pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: gzi mthu chung ba ni nus pa chung ba'o //
translated: Little power is little ability.

original: ser ba ni ser ba dag go //
analyzed: ser ba ni ser ba dag go //
translated: Hail is hail.

original: char ni char te des ni 'bru rlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char ni char te des ni 'bru rlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rain is rain. It destroys crops.

original: rdul gyis 'khrigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdul gyis 'khrigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that dust storms

original: rdul lhags pas spu ngan par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩsa tsha sgo can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdul lhags pas spu ngan par 'gyur ba'o // sa tsha sgo can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The land is dusty, and the hair of the inhabitants is bad.

original: 'bru dag mi skye ba'i sa'o //üîΩdgon dung ni chu med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bru dag mi skye ba'i sa'o // dgon dung ni chu med pa ste /
translated: The land is salty is a land where crops do not grow.

original: mya ngan lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan lta bu'o //
translated: The land is desolate is a land without water, like a desert.üîΩThe land is inferior is a land of low quality, despised, like the land of the barbarians.üîΩThe land is sinful is a land where the fields are damaged by wild animals and pigs.üîΩThe land is reversed is a land where the seasons are reversed;üîΩit is a land where it is not cold or hot or rainy at the proper time.

original: tha chad ni dman zhing smad pa ste /
analyzed: tha chad ni dman zhing smad pa ste /
translated: The land is of little fruit is a land of little harvest.üîΩThe land is of bad fruit is a land of bad harvest.üîΩThe land is of little water is a land of little rain.üîΩThe land is of bad water is a land where the water is bad.üîΩThe land is of bad earth is a land where the earth is bad.üîΩThe land is of bad people is a land where the people are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad rulers is a land where the rulers are bad.

original: kla klo la sogs pa'i sa dag go sdig pa can gyi sa ni ri dags dang phag gis nye bar gtses pa'i zhing dag go //
analyzed: kla klo la sogs pa'i sa dag go sdig pa can gyi sa ni ri dags dang phag gis nye bar gtses pa'i zhing dag go //
translated: The land is of bad harvests is a land where the harvests are bad.

original: dus log pa can 'di dag la dus yod pa ste /üîΩdus bzhin du grang ba dang dro ba dang char 'bab par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus log pa can 'di dag la dus yod pa ste / dus bzhin du grang ba dang dro ba dang char 'bab par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The land is of bad times is a land where the times are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad fruits is a land where the fruits are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad flowers is a land where the flowers are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad leaves is a land where the leaves are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad trees is a land where the trees are bad.

original: 'bras bu phra mo ni 'bras bu mi rags pa'o 'bras bu kha ba zhes bya ba ni smin pa mi snyoms zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩci las de kho nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu phra mo ni 'bras bu mi rags pa'o 'bras bu kha ba zhes bya ba ni smin pa mi snyoms zhes bya ba'i don to // ci las de kho nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The land is of bad grass is a land where the grass is bad.üîΩThe land is of bad water is a land where the water is bad.üîΩThe land is of bad earth is a land where the earth is bad.

original: gang gis dmyal ba dag tu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dmyal ba dag tu skyed pa'o //
translated: The land is of bad people is a land where the people are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad rulers is a land where the rulers are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad harvests is a land where the harvests are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad times is a land where the times are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad fruits is a land where the fruits are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad flowers is a land where the flowers are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad leaves is a land where the leaves are bad.üîΩThe land is of bad trees is a land where the trees are bad.

original: der ni sbyor bas yin la zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsbyor ba rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der ni sbyor bas yin la zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsbyor ba rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The land is of bad grass is a land where the grass is bad.

original: sdug bsngal drag po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal drag po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of intense suffering.

original: dngos ni skad cig ma gcig yin pa'i phyir dang tshor ba chung ba'i phyir 'dir dngos kyis tshe thung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: dngos ni skad cig ma gcig yin pa'i phyir dang tshor ba chung ba'i phyir 'dir dngos kyis tshe thung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: Since the actual basis is a single moment and the feeling is weak, it is reasonable to say that the actual basis is a short life.

original: gal te sbyor bas dmyal ba dag tu skye na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor bas dmyal ba dag tu skye na /
translated: If one is born in the hells through preparation,üîΩthen how do you interpret the sutra that states:

original: 'o na mdo las srog gcod pa kun du bsten pa dang / goms par bya ba dang / len mang du byas pas dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las srog gcod pa kun du bsten pa dang / goms par bya ba dang / len mang du byas pas dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Through frequently engaging in, becoming habituated with, and increasing acts of killing, one is born in the hells?üîΩTherefore he says,

original: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Because it mentions the retinue.

original: sbyor ba ni srog gcod pa'i 'khor yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni srog gcod pa'i 'khor yin te /
translated: The retinue of killing is preparation.

original: der sbyor ba la srog gcod pa btags nas de skad bshad do //
analyzed: der sbyor ba la srog gcod pa btags nas de skad bshad do //
translated: The actual basis of killing is imputed to the preparation and it is said that one is born in the hells through killing.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis las mi 'dra'i /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis las mi 'dra'i /
translated: The result that is similar to the cause is explained as the result of karmic maturation and the dominant result, but it is not different from those two.

original: 'dra ba'i khyad par las de skad bshad par zad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i khyad par las de skad bshad par zad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is merely said to be similar to the cause because it is similar to the cause.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par zad do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par zad do //
translated: It is merely said to be the result that is similar to the cause because it is similar to taking life that is pleasant.

original: gzi byin med phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzi byin med phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it lacks power.

original: gzi byin ni snying ga'i phyogs na yod do //
analyzed: gzi byin ni snying ga'i phyogs na yod do //
translated: Power exists in the region of the heart.

original: gzhan dag la yang de @69b bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de @69b bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: ma byin par len pas ni rdzas kyi bdag po la sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / longs spyod kyis phongs par byas pa dang / gzi byin med par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ma byin par len pas ni rdzas kyi bdag po la sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / longs spyod kyis phongs par byas pa dang / gzi byin med par byas pa yin te /
translated: Stealing generates suffering for the owner of the stolen object, it causes the loss of resources, and it causes the loss of power.

original: rdzas kyi dbang gis gzi byin can du gyur na de'i rgyu med par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi dbang gis gzi byin can du gyur na de'i rgyu med par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it causes the loss of the cause of power, since power arises from wealth.

original: longs spyod kyis phongs par byas pas de la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod kyis phongs par byas pas de la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes them to be deprived of wealth, it harms them.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma la nyal po byed pas ni gzhan la sdug bsngal skyed pa dang / dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du byas pa dang / 'jig rten na gzi byin gang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma la nyal po byed pas ni gzhan la sdug bsngal skyed pa dang / dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du byas pa dang / 'jig rten na gzi byin gang /
translated: By having sexual intercourse with another‚Äôs spouse, one causes suffering to another, one makes oneself a spouse with rivals, and one makes oneself devoid of the glory that is proclaimed in the world:

original: gang gi gzi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi gzi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe has glory who has a spouse.‚ÄùüîΩBy taking what was not given, one causes others to suffer, one makes oneself poor, and one makes oneself devoid of the glory that is proclaimed in the world:

original: zhes nges par brjod pa'i gzi byin med par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes nges par brjod pa'i gzi byin med par byas pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHe has glory who has wealth.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang srid tshad du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang srid tshad du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: One should apply the same method to the other [courses of action].

original: 'di ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the method.

original: thams cad mi dge ba las bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mi dge ba las bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All of the courses of action should be applied in the opposite sense to the wholesome.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pas gzhan la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / ma bsad pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pas de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pas gzhan la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / ma bsad pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pas de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: By abandoning killing, one does not cause suffering to others, one does not kill, and one does not make oneself devoid of glory. Therefore, the result is threefold:

original: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa spangs pas rdzas kyi bdag po la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / longs spyod kyis phongs par ma byas pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pa de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa spangs pas rdzas kyi bdag po la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / longs spyod kyis phongs par ma byas pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pa de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: Likewise, by abandoning taking what is not given, one does not generate suffering for the owner of the goods, one does not deprive the owner of the goods, and one does not diminish the owner‚Äôs splendor. Therefore, three results occur.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pas /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pas /
translated: By abandoning sexual misconduct,

original: gzhan la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du ma byas pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pa de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan la sdug bsngal ma bskyed pa dang / dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du ma byas pa dang / gzi byin med par ma byas pa de'i phyir de la 'bras bu rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: one does not generate suffering for another, one does not make another a wife with a rival, and one does not diminish another‚Äôs splendor. Therefore, three results occur.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other paths of action.

original: las kyi skabs su 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi skabs su 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed in the context of karma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, the result of the path of action of wrong livelihood is the three: suffering, the result of being killed, the result of being banished, and the result of being censured.‚Äù

original: de gnyis las logs shig bstan to zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' gnyis las so //
analyzed: de gnyis las logs shig bstan to zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' gnyis las so //
translated: It is taught separately from the two, wrong speech and wrong livelihood.

original: de ltar bshad na chags pa las skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang dag yin pa de dag ni log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' yang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na chags pa las skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang dag yin pa de dag ni log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' yang yin la /
translated: If this is explained in this way, then any actions of body and speech that arise from attachment are wrong speech and wrong action,

original: log pa'i 'tsho ba yin te /
analyzed: log pa'i 'tsho ba yin te /
translated: and they are also wrong livelihood.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' kho na yin no //
translated: Those that are motivated by aversion and delusion are only wrong speech and wrong action.

original: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it steals the Dharma of nonattachment.

original: chags pa'i chos ni phra mo yin yang 'phrog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i chos ni phra mo yin yang 'phrog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma of nonattachment is subtle, yet it is stolen.

original: @70a * // shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang bsrung bar sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir sbyong dka' ba'o //
analyzed: @70a * // shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang bsrung bar sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir sbyong dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to purify because it is not easy to guard even for those who are very skilled.

original: khyim pas lta ba sbyang bar dka' ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khyim pas lta ba sbyang bar dka' ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it difficult for householders to purify view?

original: rtag tu lta ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu lta ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they always have various views.

original: ngo mtshar dang / bkra shis dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / yud tsam la sogs pa'i lta ba can yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzhan la 'tsho ba rag lus pa'i //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang / bkra shis dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / yud tsam la sogs pa'i lta ba can yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzhan la 'tsho ba rag lus pa'i //
translated: It means that they are speculators about the self, the world, permanence, annihilation, extremes, beginning, and so on, and about the marvelous, auspicious, planets, stars, moments, and so on.üîΩIt is difficult for those who depend on others for their livelihood.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi lus gnas pa'i rgyu chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang / mal stan la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan la rag lus pa'i dge slong rnams kyis 'tsho ba sbyang bar dka'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi lus gnas pa'i rgyu chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang / mal stan la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan la rag lus pa'i dge slong rnams kyis 'tsho ba sbyang bar dka'o //
translated: The cause for the maintenance of the body of a monk is robes, alms, bedding, seats, and so on, which are dependent on others.

original: log pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: log pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they enjoy objects that are improper.

original: ma gnang ba'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma gnang ba'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they enjoy objects that are not permitted.

original: las kyi skabs su las su gtogs pa thams cad brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi skabs su las su gtogs pa thams cad brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since all that is included in action must be mentioned in the context of action, he says:

original: gong du 'bras bu lnga bshad pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gong du 'bras bu lnga bshad pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Those five results that were explained above.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the dominant result, the result of conscious effort, the natural result, the result of evolutionary momentum, and the result of freedom.

original: dri bcas spong ba'i lam dag gi //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri bcas spong ba'i lam dag gi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path of elimination is the path of meditative development.

original: spong ba'i lam ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin te /üîΩde'i phyir dri bcas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin te / de'i phyir dri bcas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The path of elimination is twofold: it is both contaminated and uncontaminated.üîΩTherefore, he says: ‚Äúthe path of elimination is contaminated and uncontaminated.‚Äù

original: spong ba'i phyir lam yin pa'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i phyir lam yin pa'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The path is for the sake of elimination;

original: spong ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: elimination is the analytical cessation.üîΩIt is the path because it is for the sake of elimination.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the path because it is for the sake of eliminating the defilements.

original: thob pa gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thob pa gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the path because it is for the sake of eliminating the obtainment of the latter.

original: 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bas byas pa'i khyad par yod kyi don gyi byas pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bas byas pa'i khyad par yod kyi don gyi byas pa ni med de /
translated: The difference is made by the verbal expression here, but not by the meaning,

original: gnyi gar yang bar chad med pa'i lam dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang bar chad med pa'i lam dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are connected with the path of no-more-learning.

original: rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a pleasant karmic maturation that belongs to its level.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa lam zag pa dang bcas pa'i las gang yin pa de'i sa gang yin pa der nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa lam zag pa dang bcas pa'i las gang yin pa de'i sa gang yin pa der nges pa kho na'o //
translated: The karmic maturation result is definitely on the level of any contaminated karma that is its cause.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos 'dra ba phyi ma rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos 'dra ba phyi ma rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Subsequent states that are similar to those that arise from concentration.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos 'dra ba mnyam pa dang lhag pa de'i phyi nas skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos 'dra ba mnyam pa dang lhag pa de'i phyi nas skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The result that resembles its cause is subsequent states that are similar to it, either equal or higher.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni chos gang dag de'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni chos gang dag de'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The result of conscious effort are those phenomena that arise by the power of that cause.üîΩAbandonment is also that.

original: spangs pa de yang yin no @70b zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis spangs pa thob pa'i phyir spangs pa yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: spangs pa de yang yin no @70b zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis spangs pa thob pa'i phyir spangs pa yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Abandonment is also established as the result of conscious effort because it is obtained by the power of that cause.

original: gzhan dag na re spangs pa yang lam gyi bdag po'i 'bras bur rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re spangs pa yang lam gyi bdag po'i 'bras bur rigs te /
translated: Others say that abandonment is also the dominant result of the path.

original: de'i dbang gis de mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the direct realization of that.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the ripened effect.

original: zag pa med pa la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the uncontaminated has no ripened effect.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos phyi ma rnams so //
translated: The effect of human action is the future qualities that arise from concentration.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bral ba kho na'o //üîΩskyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni nges drangs pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bral ba kho na'o // skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni nges drangs pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The effect of separation is separation itself.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gang yang ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa dang / spangs pa de yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gang yang ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa dang / spangs pa de yang yin no //
translated: The effect of human action is the qualities that are attracted by it, namely, the path of liberation and whatever future qualities arise from it, as well as the obtainment of those qualities and their abandonment.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //üîΩspong ba'i lam las gzhan pa'i las //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do // spong ba'i lam las gzhan pa'i las //
translated: The dominant effect is all conditioned states that arise later, except for those that are its essential nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Karma that is other than the path of abandonmentüîΩis the cause of the effect of separation.

original: sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa dang / sbyin pa'i sems pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa dang / sbyin pa'i sems pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: and whatever is nonvirtuous.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the effect of separation.

original: des nyon mongs pa spong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa spong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Because that does not abandon the passions,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam kho na bral ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam kho na bral ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for only the uninterrupted path is connected with the effect of separation.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba yin te /
translated: Its effect of maturation is the pleasant or unpleasant maturation belonging to its own stage,

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a virtuous contaminated action, and because it is nonvirtuous.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos 'dra ba mnyam pa dang lhag pa phyi nas skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos 'dra ba mnyam pa dang lhag pa phyi nas skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Its effect of natural outflow is subsequent similar or superior states.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang de'i stobs kyis skye ba gang dag yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang de'i stobs kyis skye ba gang dag yin pa de dag go //
translated: The effect that is the object of action is that which arises simultaneously with it and that which arises due to its power.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
translated: The dominant effect is all conditioned states that are different from it and arose previously.üîΩThe remaining uncontaminated states

original: zag pa med pa'i lhag ma dang // zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lhag ma dang // zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /
translated: are not the effect of separation, because they are not the path of complete preparation.

original: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //üîΩ'dir yang rgyu mthun @71a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do // 'dir yang rgyu mthun @71a * //
translated: They are also not the effect of karmic maturation, because they are uncontaminated and neutral.

original: pa dang skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag ni gong ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag ni gong ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The effect that is a natural outflow and the effect of the person should be stated as above.

original: las dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /

original: rigs yongs su bzung ste /üîΩde skad bshad de /
analyzed: rigs yongs su bzung ste / de skad bshad de /

original: bral ba ni dge ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba ni dge ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of the cause of separation is the opposite of the cause, because it is not the result of any virtue.

original: bral ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'am bdag po 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bral ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'am bdag po 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
translated: The result of the cause of separation is not the result of natural outcome or the dominant result.

original: dge ba 'dus byas rnams kyang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas rnams kyang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Also, conditioned virtues are not the result of separation,

original: bral ba 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because separation is unconditioned.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so//
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so//
translated: The result of the cause of karmic maturation is not the result of karmic maturation, because it is neutral.

original: mi dge ba gnyis te /
analyzed: mi dge ba gnyis te /
translated: Nonvirtue has two results:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so //üîΩde la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gang dag de'i stobs las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so // de la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gang dag de'i stobs las skyes pa'o //

analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba ma gtogs so //

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nyid do //

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni med de /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni med de /

original: mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
